meanings.definition: Present participle of dish: to serve food on dishes
meanings.sent1: She was dishing out the pasta onto the plates.
meanings.sent2: The chef was dishing up the delicious soup for the customers.
meanings.sent3: While dishing out the salad, she accidentally dropped a tomato.
meanings.sent4: He was dishing out compliments to everyone at the party.
meanings.sent5: The cafeteria worker was dishing out mashed potatoes with a smile.

meanings.definition: Present participle of dish: to gossip or talk about someone in a negative way
meanings.sent1: They were dishing about their classmate's new haircut.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends was dishing on the latest celebrity scandal.
meanings.sent3: She was dishing out the juicy details about the office drama.
meanings.sent4: The tabloids were dishing out rumors about the famous actress.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors were dishing on the new family that moved in next door.

meanings.definition: Present participle of dish: to shape or mold something like a dish
meanings.sent1: The potter was dishing the clay into a beautiful bowl shape.
meanings.sent2: She was dishing the dough into individual pie pans.
meanings.sent3: He was dishing out the sand to create a dish-like sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The artist was dishing the metal into a unique dish design.
meanings.sent5: The chef was dishing the chocolate into decorative dessert molds.

meanings.definition: Present participle of dish: to scoop or serve food onto a plate
meanings.sent1: The server was dishing the steaming curry onto the plates.
meanings.sent2: She was dishing the ice cream into bowls for the kids.
meanings.sent3: He was dishing out the hot soup carefully to avoid spills.
meanings.sent4: The caterer was dishing the appetizers onto small plates.
meanings.sent5: The cook was dishing the stir-fry onto the waiting plates.
